title: Why do most of my guy friends want me to listen to their favorite songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Music speaks volumes about a person, and many tend to bond with people with similar music tastes. If people are asking you to listen to their favorite songs, they are judging by your reaction whether or not you are compatible with them. It's part of normal human interaction -- finding a common bond. I like all sorts of music, but if somone like a particular genre (I'm not name it) over something else, I might make a decision that we won't be "close" friends, because I can't tolerate their choice of music for long. If music is playing while you are with friends, it evokes pleasant memories (usually). If I can't relate pleasant music to a friendship, I might stay away.

Giving them the benefit of the doubt, I’d say they want to share something they love with you. That’s the warmest answer, maybe we should just stick with that one, heh heh. But if we’re not giving them the benefit of the doubt, they could be seeking validation from you (bit needy), testing whether you’re cool enough to be with them (sad) or trying to impose their music taste upon you (controlling). End of the day, we each love what we love - a song, a band, a type of food, a person, whatever. We love it. It doesn’t matter one bit if nobody else in the world even *likes* it.
